title: 109_hr2076
content: The "Retired Pay Restoration Act of 2005" allows certain military retirees with service-connected disabilities to receive both retired pay and veterans' disability compensation. The Retired Pay Restoration Act of 2005 extends concurrent receipt authority to retirees with service-connected disabilities rated less than 50 percent and repeals the 50 percent requirement. It also repeals the phase-in of concurrent receipt for retirees with total service-connected disabilities. The Retired Pay Restoration Act of 2005 extends concurrent receipt authority to retirees with service-connected disabilities rated less than 50 percent and repeals the 50 percent requirement. Amendments to section 1414 include specific provisions for qualified retirees receiving veterans' disability compensation. The heading and item for section 1414 of the Retired Pay Restoration Act of 2005 are amended to allow concurrent payment of retired pay and disability compensation for eligible members. Members eligible for retired pay can now receive veterans' disability compensation concurrently. The amendments will be effective from January 1, 2006, and apply to payments starting from that date. Coordination of service eligibility for combat-related special compensation and concurrent receipt is addressed in Section 3. The eligibility criteria for TERA retirees have been amended to include those entitled to retired pay and having a combat-related disability. Additionally, standardization amendments have been made to similar provisions in the legislation. The eligibility criteria for TERA retirees have been amended to include qualified retirees who are entitled to retired pay and meet specific service requirements. The eligibility criteria for TERA retirees have been amended to include qualified retirees entitled to retired pay and veterans' disability compensation. Amendments to section 1414 of the title specify rules for Chapter 61 disability retirees, with changes effective from January 1, 2006, applying to payments from that date onwards.
